tuv.seg: Tribunals and investigations - introduction
Binsí agus imscrúduithe - réamhrá
An investigatory inquiry is usually set up when something major of significant public importance has gone wrong; often because someone has done wrong, acted unlawfully or failed to act

Socraítear fiosrúchán imscrúdaithe de ghnáth nuair a tharlaíonn rud éigin mícheart do rud lena mbaineann tábhacht shuntasach phoiblí, go minic mar gheall go ndearna duine éagóir, gur ghníomhaigh siad go mídhleathach nó gur theip orthu gníomhú
Its purpose is to find out the facts in relation to the particular matter of public concern, which has been identified by its terms of reference
Is é an cuspóir a bhaineann leis seo ná chun na fíricí a dheimhniú maidir leis an tsaincheist ar leith lena mbaineann buairt phoiblí, a bhí sainaitheanta ag a théarmaí tagartha
As well as investigating the matter, the inquiry may make recommendations to prevent it happening again
Mar aon leis an gceist a imscrúdú, féadfaidh an t-imscrúdú moltaí a dhéanamh chun cosc a chur air seo tarlú arís
It does not settle legal rights or impose penalties on individuals
Ní dhéanann sé cearta dlíthiúla a réiteach ná pionóis a ghearradh ar dhaoine
Irish law makes provision for a number of different types of investigatory inquiry
Déantar foráil i ndlí na hÉireann do líon saghsanna eile d’fhiosrúchán imscrúdaithe
These range from special inquiries established to investigate a particular event or series of events, such as tribunals of inquiry, to other inquiries such as planning inquiries
Ina measc seo, tá fiosrúcháin speisialta a bunaíodh chun imscrúdú a dhéanamh ar imeacht nó ar shraith ar leith imeachtaí, ar nós binsí fiosrúcháin, agus fiosrúcháin eile, ar nós fiosrúcháin phleanála
Not all inquiries are established using legislation, that is, on a statutory basis
Ní bhunaítear gach fiosrúchán agus an reachtaíocht á húsáid, is é sin, ar bhonn reachtúil
The findings of a particular inquiry may lead to some other form of inquiry being set up
D’fhéadfadh go n-eagrófaí foirm eile d’fhiosrúchán mar gheall ar thorthaí fiosrúcháin ar leith
Tribunals of inquiry are not permanent tribunals
Ní hionann binsí fiosrúcháin agus binsí buana
Instead, they are set up with powers to investigate specific matters
Ina ionad sin, socraítear iad le cumhachtaí chun saincheisteanna ar leith a imscrúdú
They are usually chaired by judges or senior lawyers
Is gnách go mbíonn breithiúna nó dlíodóirí sinsearacha ina gcathaoirligh orthu
At the end of the investigation, the tribunal submits a report to the Oireachtas, which may contain recommendations
Ag deireadh an imscrúdaithe, cuireann an binse tuarascáil faoi bhráid an Oireachtais, ina bhféadfaí moltaí a chuimsiú
The duration and costs of tribunals of inquiry have been an issue
Saincheist a bhí i gceist le fad agus costais bhinsí fiosrúcháin
The Comptroller and Auditor General published a Special Report into Tribunals of Inquiry in December 2008
D’fhoilsigh an tArd-Reachtaire Cuntas agus Ciste Tuarascáil Speisialta ar Bhinsí Fiosrúcháin i Nollaig 2008
More information can be found in our document on tribunals of inquiry
Is féidir leat teacht ar thuilleadh faisnéise inár gcáipéis ar bhinsí fiosrúcháin
Commissions of investigation are less expensive and speedier method of investigating matters than a tribunal of inquiry
Ní chosnaíonn coimisiúin imscrúdaithe an oiread céanna agus is bealach níos tapúla iad chun saincheisteanna a imscrúdú ná binse fiosraithe
It is set up by government order which must be approved by the Dáil and Seanad
Socraítear an coimisiún trí ordú rialtais nach mór don Dáil agus don Seanad é a fhaomhadh
The terms of reference are set by the Government or by an individual Minister
Leagann an Rialtas nó Aire aonair na téarmaí tagartha amach
The commission makes a final report on its findings to a specified Minister
Déanann coimisiún tuarascáil deiridh ar a dtorthaí le hAire sonraithe
There is more information in our document on commissions of investigation
Is féidir leat níos mó faisnéise a léamh inár gcáipéis ar choimisiúin imscrúdaithe
There is a range of specialised legislation regulating particular sectors, such as the Companies Act 1990, which provide for investigations
Tá réimse de reachtaíocht speisialaithe ann a rialaíonn earnálacha ar leith, ar nós Acht na gCuideachtaí, 1990, a dhéanann foráil d’imscrúduithe
The following are some examples:
Seo a leanas roinnt samplaí:

• Part 2 of the Companies Act 1990 (Part 13 of the Companies Act 2014 when it is commenced) provides for the appointment of inspectors to investigate the affairs of a company, in particular situations
• Déanann Cuid 2 d’Acht na gCuideachtaí, 1990 (Cuid 13 d’Acht na gCuideachtaí, 2014 nuair a chuirtear tús leis) foráil do chigirí a cheapadh chun gnóthaí cuideachta a imscrúdú, i gcásanna ar leith

• Under the European Union (Railway Safety) (Reporting and Investigation of Serious Accidents, Accidents and Incidents) Regulations 2014 the Railway Accident Investigation Unit (RAIU) investigates railway accidents and incidents

• Faoi Rialacháin an Aontais Eorpaigh (Sábháilteacht Iarnróid) (Timpistí Tromchúiseacha, Timpistí agus Teagmhais a Thuairisciú agus a Imscrúdú), 2014, déanann an tAonad Imscrúdaithe Timpistí Iarnróid (AITI) imscrúdú ar thimpistí agus theagmhais iarnróid

• The Merchant Shipping (Investigation of Marine Casualties) Act 2000 and the European Communities (Merchant Shipping) (Investigation of Accidents) Regulations 2011 provide for the investigation by the Marine Casualty Investigation Board (MCIB) into marine casualties that take place in Irish waters or involve Irish registered vessels

• Déanann an tAcht Loingis Tráchtála (Fiosrú Taismeach Muirí), 2000 agus Rialacháin na gComhphobal Eorpach (Loingeas Trádála) (Fiosrú Timpistí), 2011 foráil d’imscrúdú ag an mBord um Imscrúdú Taismí Muirí (BITM) ar thaismigh mhuirí a thiteann amach in uiscí na hÉireann nó ina mbíonn baint ag árthaí cláraithe Éireannacha

• The Air Accident Investigation Unit (AAIU) investigates aircraft accidents and incidents that occur within the State under the Air Navigation (Notification and Investigation of Accidents, Serious Incidents and Incidents) Regulations 2009

• Déanann an tAonad um Imscrúdú Aerthionóiscí (AIAT) imscrúdú ar thimpistí aerárthaigh agus ar theagmhais a tharlaíonn laistigh den Stát faoi na Rialacháin Aerloingseoireachta (Timpistí, Teagmhais Thromchúiseacha agus Teagmhais a Fhógairt agus a Imscrúdú), 2009
Investigations are also carried out by other bodies, such as, the Office of the Comptroller and Auditor-General and the Office of the Ombudsman
Anuas air sin, tugann comhlachtaí eile, ar nós Oifig an Ard-Reachtaire Cuntas agus Ciste agus Oifig an Ombudsman faoi imscrúduithe
The Oireachtas has a specialised system of committees which advises on a wide range of legislative, social, economic and financial business
Tá córas speisialaithe coistí ag an Oireachtas a thugann comhairle ar réimse fairsing gnó reachtaíochta, shóisialta, eacnamaíoch agus airgeadais
On an ongoing basis, committees publish reports and results of their investigations
Ar bhonn leanúnach, foilsíonn coistí tuarascálacha agus torthaí a gcuid imscrúduithe
A few special Oireachtas inquiries have also been held, such as the Parliamentary inquiry into D.I.R.T
Cuireadh roinnt imscrúduithe de chuid an Oireachtais ar bun, ar nós an imscrúdaithe Pharlaimintigh ar D.I.R.T
in 1999, but in general they have faced legal challenges
i 1999, ach go ginearálta, cuireadh agóidí dlíthiúla ar bun ina gcoinne

The Houses of the Oireachtas (Inquiries, Privileges and Procedures) Act 2013, which came into effect in September 2013, provides for the holding of inquiries into matters of public importance by the Oireachtas

Forálann An tAcht um Thithe an Oireachtais (Fiosrúcháin, Pribhléidí agus Nósanna Imeachta), 2013, a tháinig i bhfeidhm i Meán Fómhair 2013, d’fhiosrúcháin a chur ar bun ag an Oireachtas ar shaincheisteanna lena mbaineann tábhacht phoiblí
Inquiries can be concerned with systems, practices, procedures, policies and the implementation of policy, and the effectiveness of legislative and regulatory systems
Féadfaidh na fiosrúcháin a bheith bainteach le córais, cleachtais, nósanna imeachta, beartais agus beartas a chur i bhfeidhm, agus éifeachtacht na gcóras reachtaíochta agus rialála
Such inquiries may not make any findings that adversely affect the good name of someone who is not:
Ní féidir leis na fiosrúcháin sin aon chinntí a dhéanamh a imríonn drochthionchar ar dhea-cháil duine:
• A member of the Dáil or Seanad, or
• Nach comhalta den Dáil nó den Seanad iad, nó
• Someone who is directly accountable to the Oireachtas
• Nach duine iad atá cuntasach go díreach don Oireachtas
A proposed Constitutional amendment to give such powers to the Oireachtas was rejected by the people in 2011
Dhiúltaigh muintir na tíre leasú beartaithe Bunreachtúil chun na cumhachtaí sin a bhronnadh ar an Oireachtas in 2011
In November 2014, a Committee of Inquiry into the Banking Crisis was established under the 2013 Act
I Samhain 2014, bunaíodh Coiste Fiosrúcháin ar an nGéarchéim Bhaincéireachta faoi 2013
The purpose of the Inquiry is to inquire into the reasons Ireland experienced a systemic banking crisis
Is é cuspóir an Fhiosrúcháin chun fiosrúchán a dhéanamh ar na cúiseanna a raibh Éire thíos le géarchéim chórasach bhaincéireachta
Statutory and non-statutory inquiries
Fiosrúcháin reachtúla agus neamhreachtúla
Not all inquiries are set up on a statutory basis
Ní chuirtear gach fiosrúchán ar bun ar bhonn reachtúil

In 2000 the Minister for Health and Children established the Dunne Post Mortem Inquiry and in 2012 commissioned a report from Professor Walsh, independent researcher, on the practice of symphysiotomy in Ireland

In 2000, bhunaigh an tAire Sláinte agus Leanaí Fiosrúchán ar Scrúdú Iarbháis Dunne agus in 2012, coimisiúnaíodh tuarascáil ón Ollamh Walsh, taighdeoir neamhspleách, ar chleachtas simfiseatóime in Éirinn
Sometimes a preliminary inquiry may be held in order to make the work of the main inquiry easier
Amanna, is féidir réamhfhiosrúchán a chur ar bun chun obair níos fusa a dhéanamh d’obair an phríomhfhiosrúcháin

The Commission to Inquire into Child Abuse was initially established on an administrative basis in 1999 before being established on a statutory basis in 2000 under the Commission to Inquire into Child Abuse Act 2000

Bunaíodh an Coimisiún chun Mí-Úsáid Leanaí a Fhiosrú i dtosach báire ar bhonn riaracháin i 1999 sular bunaíodh é ar bhonn reachtúil in 2000 faoin Acht um Choimisiún chun Drochúsáid Leanaí a Fhiosrú, 2000
Further information on inquiries and investigations is available in the Law Reform Commission’s 2003 Consultation Paper on Public Inquiries (pdf)
Tá fáil ar bhreis faisnéise ar fhiosrúcháin agus ar imscrúduithe ó Pháipéar Comhairliúcháin um Fhiosrúcháin Phoiblí (pdf) 2003 an Choimisiúin um Athchóiriú an Dlí
Following on from an inquiry, often a compensation tribunal or scheme has been set up to compensate the victims of the episode or conduct which was under investigation at the inquiry
Ag leanúint ó fhiosrúchán, is minic gur bunaíodh binse nó scéim cúitimh chun íospartaigh na heachtra nó an iompair a bhí ina n-ábhar imscrúdaithe ag an bhfiosrúchán a chúiteamh
The following are examples of such compensation schemes:
Seo a leanas samplaí de na scéimeanna cúitimh sin:
• The Hepatitis Compensation Tribunal was set up in 1995
• Bunaíodh an Binse Cúitimh Heipitítis i 1995

It provides compensation to those infected with Hepatitis C or HIV as a result of the use of Human Immunoglobulin Anti-D or as a result of the receipt of a blood transfusion or blood product within the State

Soláthraíonn sé cúiteamh dóibh siúd atá galraithe le Heipitíteas C nó le SEIF mar thoradh ar Ghlóbailin Imhdíonachta Dhaonna Frith-D a úsáid nó mar thoradh go ndearnadh fuilaistriú ort nó gur tugadh táirge fola duit laistigh den Stát
• The Residential Institutions Redress Board was established in 2002
• Bunaíodh an Bord Sásamh d’Institiúidí Cónaithe in 2002
It was set up to compensate those who, as children, were abused while resident in industrial schools, reformatories and other institutions subject to State regulation or inspection

Bunaíodh é chun cúiteamh a thabhairt dóibh siúd ar baineadh mí-úsáid astu nuair a bhídís ina leanaí, fad a bhí cónaí orthu i scoileanna saothair, scoileanna ceartúcháin nó in institiúidí eile faoi réir rialáil nó imscrúdú an Stáit

• Caranua was established in 2013 under the Residential Institutions Statutory Fund Act 2012 to help those who experienced abuse in residential institutions and have received settlements through the Residential Institutions Redress Board or the courts

• Bunaíodh Caranua in 2013 faoin Acht um an gCiste Reachtúil Foras Cónaithe, 2012 chun cabhrú leo siúd a bhí thíos le mí-úsáid in institiúidí cónaithe agus a bhain réitigh amach tríd an mBord Sásamh d’Institiúidí Cónaithe nó trí na cúirteanna
• The Symphysiotomy Payment Scheme was set up in 2014 to provide ex-gratia payments to women who underwent a surgical symphysiotomy or a pubiotomy in any hospital in the State between 1940 and 1990

• Bunaíodh an Scéim Íocaíochta Simfiseatóime in 2014 chun íocaíochtaí ex-gratia a sholáthar do mhná a thug faoi shimfiseatóime mháinliachta nó faoi phúbatóime in aon ospidéal sa Stát idir 1940 agus 1990
